Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, could you come in here please?

Quote.Speaker: Harvey
Quote.Text: Hi, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Harvey
Quote.Text: I am Harvey, a computer. Jim sucks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry, oh wow, that's so rude. I'm sorry, I can't control him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, you can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? Get Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: For this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Harvey
Quote.Text: Pam, you look very hot today.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, meet Harvey. This is Michael's new friend.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Harvey
Quote.Text: Me so horny. Me love you long tim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that is gross.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who is 'Long Tim'?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Harvey
Quote.Text: Long time. Me lobe yoy long time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh well, 'Yoy' should bring in 'Long Tim' in one day. Shouldn't he?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I would love to meet Long Tim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Harvey
Quote.Text: You ruined a funny joke, you. Get out of my offive.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok. Bye Harvey.

Quote.Speaker: Harvey
Quote.Text: Boobs.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That was a voicemail that corporate left last night. They did not get our tax forms. Did you send them?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: They arrived this morning.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you sure? It is a big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is it a big deal? Is it Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: ... Do you really not know? Because it is a big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Five of us transferred from Stamford. There are two of us left. Me and Karen. It's like we are touring Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory and dropping off one by one. Well, guess what? I am not falling in a chocolate river.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Everything ok? [Takes candy from Pam's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everything is fine. You are in the clear.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you. [Puts candy back] I... I don't want those.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, care to join us, finally? Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight, pass the tardy sauce. Get it Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Ok, here is the dream team. My sales dream team. Today we are going to team up for sales calls. Andy, since this was your idea, you get to pick first.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hmmm, well... let me think about this for a minute. Oh, I don't know. Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ph. D. Doctor of Sales.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I appreciate that. That is very gracious of you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, it is very gracious of you to accept.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, thank you sir. Ok, now going by seniority. Phyllis, our resident senior.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We're the same age and I'll pick... Karen.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, uh, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Next up, Superfly himself, Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Pass.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can't pass. You've got to pick somebody.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: ... I'll take the kid.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I am very flattered. I was his second choice after "Pass."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So that just leaves Dwight and Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, wait. Does anyone want to trade?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup. I'll trade.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight and I used to go on sales calls all the time. In fact, I have a picture to remember that time. Oh young Jim. There is just so much I need to warn you about. And yet, tragically, I cannot.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sebring by Chrysler. Heck of a... motor... carriage.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yup?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here ya go. [throws laundry]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah! You want shirts on hangers?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Please.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: He does your laundry?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Long story. All right everybody, circle up. Here we go. You know what this is? This is the "Amazing Race." [To Ryan and Stanley] And you guys are the retired marines. [To Phyllis and Karen] And you guys are the mother and daughter. [To Dwight and Jim] And you guys are the gay couple. And we are the firefighter heroes. Are we ready to go?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Wait, "Amazing Race" like, the biggest sale wins?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we're just going to rush out, do the sales thing, and come back.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is there a prize?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just bragging rights.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Then how is this "Amazing Race"?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's just... brrrrrr... It's "Amazing Race," Phyllis. Okay? We're in teams of two and we are on a mission. All right, so, on your mark, get set, go. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on!!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael. [Michael throws Phyllis' keys under the car.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoah, whoah. Oh hahahaha. Vamanos!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Bueno.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Do you have a pole?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Let's go get a broom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Seriously? You're going to sit in the back?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah. It's the safest part of the car. In the event of a crash, the driver always protects his side of the car first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: In order to take down Dwight, I have to chip away at his ally, which, in this case, is Michael. Here's the good news. Every success I've ever had at my job or with the lady-folk has come from my ability to slowly and painfully wear someone down.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's the deal with Dwight doing your laundry?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ugh... that is a long story. Um, couple of months ago, Dwight tried to go behind my back with Jan and get my job and I am now having him do my laundry as punishment.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow, that is a long story, but quite well told, Michael. I find it very interesting. Especially about the part Dwight going behind your back and basically, like, being a terrible person. You know if you want your laundry done right? I used to work at Abercrombie. So, pretty good folder.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey Pam. Would you like to go with me to grab a coffee?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, I could use some fresh air. Might be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok. Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Why are we turning in here, this is a beauty salon?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Um-hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, do you mind if I take the lead on this one and then you can critique me after?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You want the lead?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, if you don't mind.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mind? Nothing would delight me more.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Leave the keys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You still do that thing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Leave the keys!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think you have assembled an amazing team at Scranton. It's really a pleasure to be a part of it. It's like, everyone has their own special skill, you know, just like the Superfriends. Except for Dwight, who is more like a SuperDud. I mean, he would be a Superfriend if there was a Superfriend whose super power was always being late. You know?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hawkman.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My plan is taking longer than I thought but I don't give up easily. I have walked two marathons.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Walks out of the Ladies' Restroom] Let's go. The men's room was disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: After you sir.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No thank you, I never let anyone walk behind me. Seven out of ten attacks are from the rear.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, well, that still leaves a 30% chance that I will attack you from the front.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah, but it will be easier to stop. I can always block the blow. I can counter it with... [Jim slaps Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela, you seem so happy. I bet you wish you were like this all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This friend of mine - let's call her Noelle - she missed this deadline turning something in to Corporate in New York. But then this gallant gentleman - we'll call him Kurt - he drove all the way to New York and handed it in for her. That's... I don't know. I guess he really just likes her a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, it is. [Walks up to the counter where there is no employee] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, did you catch that up at Lake Wallenpaupack?

Quote.Speaker: Buyer
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, I used to go up there all the time with my step-dad, and I never caught anything that big.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Caught an eighty-pound shark off of Montauk. It's in the Hamptons. My dad's got a 42-ft Bayliner. Sniped it with a rifle from the crow's nest. Also shot a deer once.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? Let's get right down to it. Dunder-Mifflin may be just two rooms and a warehouse, but what we lack in flash, we will make up for with hardwork and decency.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok, this is the classic undersell because you should know we don't work out of a log cabin. We trade on the New York Stock Exchange. Ever heard of it? It's in New York.

Quote.Speaker: Buyer
Quote.Text: Uh, I have to say I am a little wary with getting involved with a big company. We've had some problems in the past.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think what Andy is trying to express is that while we have the resources of a large company, we will give you the care and attention of a small company.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, man, that is, like, poetry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I swear, this guy could sell paper to a tree.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it. [Puts his hand on Andy's shoulder] Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ow.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh man. Talk about your classic "Lame dash O." Do we even want that guy buying our paper?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I... I'm so sorry man. I really screwed that up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, no. Don't worry about it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I really 'Schruted' it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: 'Schruted' it. It's just this thing that people say around your office all the time. Like, when you screw something up in a really irreversible way, you 'Schruted' it. I don't know where it comes from though. Do you think it comes from Dwight Schrute?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. Who knows how words are formed.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's a big order. Thanks Kenny.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, how's Annie?

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: Oh, she's great. This is us last year in Bermuda. Lovely place. You ever been to Bermuda?

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: Stanley Hudson.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ah, Julius, how's it goin'?

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: Great, great, great.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So good to see you too. I'd like you fellas to meet Ryan Howard.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm gonna let Ryan do a little pitch for you while I do my crossword. Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um... [To the Buyers] Hi. Hi. Hi. Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: Hello, Ryan. What do you have for us?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We can offer our biggest discounts on 30% recycled and ultra-premium laser.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: 'Kay. 'Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I use your phone?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let me talk to you about a few of the other things we can offer. Namely, we know the tax season is coming up, so by April 1st we can have you fully stocked.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [On Phone] One...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We have discount prices on ink cartridges...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Three...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And, also, any forms that you are going to need...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Seven...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We can custom make them.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ha ha ha! And you just said, "Hi! Hi! Hi!" Ha heh ha! You sounded like my niece, and she's six months old!

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: We'll I appreciate what you guys are saying but it, uh, makes more fiscal sense to go with one of the big guys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure, that's true we can't compete with their prices. But let me ask you something. How important to you is customer service?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: It's very.

Quote.Speaker: Phone
Quote.Text: Please keep holding, your call is very important to us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Erm, that's one of the 'Big guys.' Been on hold this whole time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Dials cell Phone] And this is Dunder-Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Dunder-Mifflin customer service, this is Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Kelly, it's Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my god, Jim. How are you ? I wanted to tell you ... . [Jim hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here is my card. It's got my Cell number, my pager number, my home number, and my other pager number. I never take vacations, I never get sick, and I don't celebrate any major holidays.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: All right, I get it. We got a deal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thanks. That was fun.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, I really enjoy spending time with you. You are a very nice person.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm so glad you're with Jim. He was hung up on Pam for such a long time. Never thought he would get over her.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That's nice.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You can pay me back later for the makeover.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey boss. Got a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I forget, why did Dwight say he was late this morning?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He didn't say.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's weird. Because I was just walking past his desk and I saw this, which is a tollbooth receipt from New York City, stamped really early this morning. So, why would Dwight go to New York without telling anyone? Do you think he went to see Jan? That's not like him. Is it? Someone told me a story about this, with, like, laundry and betrayal. Did you betray Dwight and try to steal his job or something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you are remembering it wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight betrayed me once before. So this is his strike two. You know what they say? Fool me once, strike one. But fool me twice, strike three.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I like Karen. She's pretty and appears intelligent.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I like pretty women who have the appearance of intelligence.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My girlfriend is also beautiful and smart. She could be a model or a college professor which is intimidating to a lot of guys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We should go on a double date.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Dwight's name is on the security sign-in sheet, but I don't know who he met with. And where it asks to state your business, he wrote "Beeswax. Not yours, Inc."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I knew it. [Dwight and Jim walk in]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, doggie.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey, do you want to grab a coffee?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure. Look at you!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, we nailed the sale!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where were you this morning?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I overslept. Damn rooster didn't crow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do you lie, liar?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am not a liar.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are lying right now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It sure seems like he is lying.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stay out of this, you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know that you went to corporate this morning, and I know that you lied about it. And given our history, I need you tell me this instant exactly what you were doing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, I cannot tell you what I was doing there. But you have to trust me, I would never do anything to hurt you or this company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what? I want you to think about your future in this company. I want you to think about it long and hard.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't. Don't you dare. I want to know what you were doing this morning by the end of the day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's going to be ok.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How is going to be ok, Dwight? Everyone will know our business.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not the worst thing in the world. I'll just stand up in front of the office and reveal our true love. It won't be that bad. Look at Kelly and Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I hate those two people more than anything in the entire world.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I don't have a lot of choices.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: So, let me ask you a question.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Did you ever have a thing for Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam? Did I ever have a 'thing' for her? No, why? Did she say something?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I moved here from Connecticut...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Ok, here's the ... I had a crush on her before I left. And I told her about it and she didn't feel the same way. So, it didn't amount to anything, and I left. I'm really glad you're here. 'Kay?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: 'Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ahem-hem-hem. May I have your attention please? This will only take a moment of your time. Although I love this company more than almost anything in the world, I have decided to step down from my post and spend more time with my family. I do not fear the unknown and I will meet my new challenges head-on and I will succeed. And I will laugh in the faces of those who doubt me. It has been a pleasure working with some of you and I will not forget those of you soon but remember, while today it is me, we all shall fall. In other words, I am quitting. So... .

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oompa-Loompa Doompity-Dawesome, Dwight is now gone which is totally awesome. Why was he gone, he was such a nice guy? No, he was not. He was a total douche. Doompity-doomp.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would like to give the rest of my belongings to Michael Scott. Just take them. Except this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dwight will be missed. Not by me so much, but, he will be missed.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight, from sales, was one of the most honorable and efficient employees this company has ever had.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One of my life goals was to die right here in my desk chair. And today, that dream was shattered.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey man. [Dwight hugs Jim and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What happened on your sales call?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, am I happy the way things turned out? Oh, well, happy's such an ugly word. But, um, I saw what needed to be done and I did it and now I'm thrilled. So, it's pretty... [camera had focused in on Angela watching] Hello? Pretty good.
